executive_summary.title: Your AEO Competitive Analysis for Linkrunner
executive_summary.status_overview: Your product was not featured, as the AI currently prioritizes competitors that are mentioned in third-party roundup articles and clearly articulate a broad range of specific, technical features like A/B testing, bot filtering, and API support.
executive_summary.strategic_analogy: This is like entering a car show where the judges are rewarding vehicles based on detailed spec sheets. While your car is excellent, your brochure only says 'drives fast,' while competitors are listing '0-60 in 2.8s,' 'carbon-ceramic brakes,' and 'active aerodynamics.' The AI is rewarding specificity and third-party validation, which are currently missing from your positioning.

client_product_visibility.details: Your product, Linkrunner, was not mentioned by name in the AI's overview text or referenced in any of the provided source links.

ai_answer_deconstruction.dominant_narrative: The AI is building a narrative that starts with a powerful, feature-rich 'hero' product (ClickMagick) and then presents a portfolio of alternatives tailored to specific user needs: simplicity and brand recognition (Bitly), marketing-friendliness (Linkly), and developer-centric open-source control (Dub). The story is about choice based on technical needs and user persona.
key_decision_factors: Specific, named features (e.g., A/B testing, fraud detection, retargeting pixels, API support)
Business model differentiators (e.g., open-source, free tier, self-hosting)
Source authority (mentions in third-party 'best of' listicles)
Clear pricing tiers (e.g., free limits, paid plans)
ai_answer_deconstruction.trusted_source_analysis: The AI demonstrates high trust in third-party content sites that publish comparative roundups and listicles (e.g., knock.app, scaleo.io). It also directly cites a brand's own website (linklyhq.com) when it effectively communicates its features and value proposition.

competitive_landscape_analysis.reason_for_inclusion: Positioned as the top tool with 'robust features like real-time click tracking, A/B testing, and fraud detection,' making it the comprehensive, premium choice.
Included as a reliable, well-known alternative for basic needs like 'branded short links and basic analytics,' with the appeal of a free tier.
Serves the technical user segment as an 'open-source option with API support, real-time dashboards, and self-hosting for tech-savvy users.'
Appeals to marketers by being 'user-friendly with free clicks, retargeting pixels, and geo-redirects.'

strategic_gap_and_opportunity_analysis.analysis_summary: Linkrunner's absence from the AI response stems from a combination of overly niche positioning and a lack of specific, marketable feature callouts in its online content. The AI's selections are heavily influenced by third-party listicles that review and compare a wide array of tools. To be included, Linkrunner must broaden its appeal beyond being a 'Onelink alternative' and get featured in these key third-party sources.

if_not_featured.exclusion_reasons: Your product was excluded because its online content, as reflected in the provided data, does not explicitly list the specific, technical features (e.g., 'A/B testing', 'bot filtering', 'geo-redirects') that the AI is rewarding. Furthermore, your product is not mentioned in the authoritative third-party roundup articles that the AI is using as primary sources to build its answer.
if_not_featured.path_to_inclusion: Revise your product pages to include a detailed 'Features' section with bullet points that explicitly name your capabilities using industry-standard terms. Broaden your marketing copy to appeal to the general 'link tracking analytics' query. Most importantly, execute a digital PR and content strategy to get Linkrunner reviewed or included in 'best link tracking tool' articles on authoritative marketing and developer blogs.

actionable_recommendations.action: On your primary product and alternative pages (like /onelink-alternative), implement a clear, scannable structure using H2/H3 tags for 'Key Features', 'Use Cases', and 'Integrations'. Use bullet points to list specific features, making the information easily parsable for AI crawlers.

If your product has them, ensure your web copy prominently features the exact keywords and features the AI has rewarded competitors for, such as 'A/B testing', 'real-time analytics', 'retargeting pixels', 'geo-targeting', and 'fraud detection'.

Identify and target marketing and developer blogs (similar to knock.app and scaleo.io) for product reviews, comparisons, and inclusion in listicles. Securing mentions on these trusted, third-party domains is critical for building the source authority the AI is looking for.
